section.title: Dependent prepositions
section.sectiontitle: There are some verbs that are followed by a preposition.
section.text2a: I'd like to contribute to your fund.
section.sectiontitle2: With some verbs, an object comes before the preposition.
section.text4a: My mother prevented me from dropping out of university.

section.title: Dependent prepositions
section.sectiontitle: There are some nouns that are followed by prepositions.
section.text1a: She's an expert in the field of molecular biology.
section.text2a: Long journeys have a bad effect on me.
section.sectiontitle2: There are some adjectives that are followed by prepositions.
section.text4a: Bob Dylan is famous for his brilliant lyrics.

section.title: Dependent prepositions
section.sectiontitle: Sometimes prepositions can begin common phrases.
section.text1a: On one occasion I lost my car keys.
section.text2a: He married the girl in the end.
